channel.name: Can we connect local node to UI?

messages.content: Currently when we send a transaction it takes time to confirm and hence some waiting time on the UI. However, for faster development over UI, is it possible to run a local node with fast block time so that it is quicker to get the txs confirmed in the UI for development purposes?

`Mina.LocalBlockchain` works like a charm on Node.js for testing purposes.
It probably works on browsers too.
However you can't interact with Auro Wallet as there is no RPC to connect.
It will take some effort and complicate the UI's source code, but you can make it optional to connect Auro Wallet, and make transactions using `Mina.LocalBlockchain` for development purposes. 
In production you can still use Auro Wallet.
```ts
const Local = Mina.LocalBlockchain({ proofsEnabled: false })
Mina.setActiveInstance(Local)
```
Makes sense thanks
You can run local chain with gql api and connect to that https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1168469504997720135/1168872551011852359

Not sure if it's released yet but we're bundling a local node with the zkapp cli, so you can do

zk lightnet start

and it starts up a node with parameters tuned for light weight and fast block production

You can try to run it in the docker environment, but I was unable to run it on Mac Silicon:
https://hub.docker.com/r/o1labs/mina-local-network

I've upgraded zk to 0.15.0, there is a command 
```
zk lightnet start
```
but it does not work on my Mac M2 Max; gives the error:
```
The current machine does not support all of the following CPU features that are required by the image: [CX8, CMOV, FXSR, MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4_1, SSE4_2, POPCNT, LZCNT, AVX, AVX2, BMI1, BMI2, FMA].
```
when trying to start the docker image and waiting indefinitely for the service (:3086) to be ready...
Oh that's good to know, will raise an issue. It's based on a docker image that doesn't seem to support M2 currently

I've raised it already on the repo that the docker image is referring to. Not sure that it is the right repo to use:
https://github.com/o1-labs/rfcs/issues/41
Oh ok thanks!
Transferred it to the zkapp cli repo

Hey folks, thanks for reporting this.
Can I ask anyone to try it again please on the Mac with Apple silicon?
`zk lightnet start` should pull the latest image with possible fix.

I've tried it on a MacBook Pro M2 Max running zk 0.15.2, it gives an error
```
2023-12-05 12:53:30 The current machine does not support all of the following CPU features that are required by the image: [CX8, CMOV, FXSR, MMX, SSE, SSE2, SSE3, SSSE3, SSE4_1, SSE4_2, POPCNT, LZCNT, AVX, AVX2, BMI1, BMI2, FMA].
2023-12-05 12:53:30 Please rebuild the executable with an appropriate setting of the -march option.2023/12/05 08:53:30 [notice] 131#131: signal process started
```
and waits forever for blockchain network readines:
```
✔ Checking the Docker Engine availability
✔ Checking prerequisites
✔ Stopping and removing the existing Docker container
✔ Pulling the corresponding Docker image
✔ Starting the lightweight Mina blockchain network Docker container
✔ Preserving the network configuration
⠧ Waiting for the blockchain network readiness...
```
logs are attached
Got it, thank you @DFST I was hoping it will work with generic build with optimisation disabled but it seems we need specific build. Will continue.

When running the image o1labs/mina-local-network:o1js-main-latest-lightnet using `docker run`, I've got an error
```
WARNING: The requested image's platform (linux/amd64) does not match the detected host platform (linux/arm64/v8) and no specific platform was requested
```
so it seems like it should be rebuilt for linux/arm64/v8
This or something like `-march=compatibility`
Ok, it seems that the only good way to solve is to actually cross-build images on hardware with apple silicon 😦
I also wondering if Apple's Rosetta could be helpful here at all?
It takes forever to start with the emulation. I guess the issue is that all of the mina docker images are hardcoded for x86 right?
Yeah I mean the easiest way was build it on x86/amd64 Linux machine
Ok, forever is not good at all, I’ll try with herzner’s arm VMs then
Thank you @Faserisko

x86/amd64:
```
docker buildx ls
NAME/NODE           DRIVER/ENDPOINT             STATUS   BUILDKIT             PLATFORMS
mybuilder *         docker-container
  mybuilder0        unix:///var/run/docker.sock running  v0.12.4              linux/amd64, linux/amd64/v2, linux/amd64/v3, linux/386
```

and arm-based VM:
```
docker buildx ls
NAME/NODE    DRIVER/ENDPOINT             STATUS  BUILDKIT             PLATFORMS
mybuilder *  docker-container
  mybuilder0 unix:///var/run/docker.sock running v0.12.4              linux/arm64, linux/arm/v7, linux/arm/v6
default      docker
  default    default                     running v0.11.7+d3e6c1360f6e linux/arm64, linux/arm/v7, linux/arm/v6
```
So might help I believe
If you are using official mina images for daemon I don't think it will work. All of them have hard coded x86 dependencies in dockerfiles.
We build lightnet one a bit differently so we can impact the process
Is it public somewhere?
Not yet

Ah right I see that you copy the built executable directly to the image. That should work if you've built the executable on arm cpu.

https://hub.docker.com/layers/o1labs/mina-local-network/o1js-main-latest-lightnet/images/sha256-c7c3ec09f20ceb547fcf1fdcc43b1fff556c5447b8136e46ad58235d9e39538d?context=explore
I can build it on my Mac if it helps, but I need kind of exact instructions and a script to do it.

Yes, exactly, so I'll try replicate vanilla Dune build system on Arm based VM or try to use Nix if first option will fail, will keep you updated.
It won't happen today though.
Thank you but let's keep thi option as the last resort, I also found mac with M1 Pro chip nearby so can proceed with testing it too
Wouldn't it be easier to replicate the build directly in dockerfile? That would be also super helpful if other mina images were done this way.
I think we already have somehting like this

https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/blob/develop/dev/README.md
but probably not maintained for a while
Yeah, those have hardcoded x86 dependencies all over the place
That's what I thought you were using in the first place
Ah I see, yeah platform agnostic build system will be useful indeed, something to work on after this

So, good news, I was able to setup the build system on Arm-based VM and I was able to build the image for it to 🎉 
You can try `zk lightnet start --mina-branch develop` on your Apple silicon, works for me with M1Pro.
Next up I'll need to polish the things and do some refactoring in order to have Arm images be part of our Nightly pipeline.
I'll let you know once it will be GA.
Thank you all for the help!
P.S. Mentioned lightnet Docker image (https://hub.docker.com/layers/o1labs/mina-local-network/develop-latest-lightnet/images/sha256-c41e26f35fb9070681cdd95a145f2e552333267d3e20a956ad5e88ff6d5843ef?context=explore) will be overridden in ~5-6 hours.

hm okay, when I restart the container manually it works
not sure what is that but based on the timeline you may used some tmp images that I was pushing to check stuff in preparation for actual multi-arch support

I just started the CI pipeline to get new ones published in a matter of `~1h30m`.
Nothin will change for the end user, you still should continue to use same commands as before (raw `docker run ...` or `zk lightnet start`) and Docker Engine on your host machine should properly identify which image to pull.
Thanks, I will test it with new images
I'll let you know once jobs are done

```
Error: Failed to send transaction { statusCode: 404, statusText: 'Not Found' }
```
The same code works on Testworld2 and local blockchain

> I'll let you know once jobs are done

images prepared with `-<arch>` suffix but manifests is yet to be created and pushed in order to serve 2 images by same tag name to let `zk lightnet ...` work without a need in `zkapp-cli` changes.
Ok it is finished now, `1h29m` not bad as for the 12 images (including Mina artifacts build).
You should be able to do `zk lightnet start`

> The node sends first transaction and fails on sending the second one with the error
@DFST Can you please try with `zk lightnet start` (it uses `o1labs/mina-local-network:o1js-main-latest-lightnet` image)
Other versions of Docker images might not work with the currently released O1JS so you will need to build it locally
But majority of cases should be covered by `o1labs/mina-local-network:o1js-main-latest-lightnet` I believe
@Faserisko can you also retry please and let me know if there will be any additional issue?
Now `zk lightnet start` works (before it was failing on image loading), and the code works as expected. Thank you!
Glad it works, thank you for help
We also work on documenting the lightnet sub-command and related stuff to be published on public docs website

@Faserisko sorry for delay, I’m not usually checking Discord that often so better tag me directly next time.
Now to the problem, it will be great to know more about your env. Which OS and version, cpu architecture, allowed resources for docker engine (if configurable for you OS), how exactly you spin up the container (using zkapp-cli or directly)? If container dies you still should be able to get logs from its file system, you can use `zk lightnet logs save` command to do so or download files manually from container’s path `/root/logs/*.log`.
You can also use `docker logs …` command to fetch container’s stdout/stderr
Hi there @Serhii , just trying to start it and got and error too.
Running on Ubuntu 22.04, AMD Ryzen 9 5950X.
I have docker already installed:  Docker version 24.0.7, build afdd53b

Running now ! ```docker run --rm --pull=always -it   --env NETWORK_TYPE="single-node"   --env PROOF_LEVEL="none"   --env LOG_LEVEL="Info"   -p 3085:3085   -p 5433:5432   -p 8081:8080   -p 8181:8181   -p 8282:8282   o1labs/mina-local-network:o1js-main-latest-lightnet```
Problem was ports 8080 and 5432 conflicting with already used ports
I assume zk uses the standard configuration

Hey @Mario | Socialcap thanks for sharing. Yeah we currently use some of default ports. `zk lightnet…` also has the `—debug` option to see the commands stderr.
If you think it will be good to have an option to remap ports then please let me know or alternatively you can file an issue against the `zkapp-cli ` repo.

Hi there. No, its ok for me. Just seems simpler for me to use docker run instead of the zk lightnet starter.  But will raise an issue to improve the error message and show the options used for run , so it will be easier to see what was the cause of the error . Thanks
Thank you
https://github.com/o1-labs/zkapp-cli/issues/544
